attributes.comment:
On behalf of my husband Brian and myself, I am writing with concerns about the
proposed Immigration Benefit Application/Petition and Biometric fee increase.

We are parents-to-be of a child from China and our dream of completing our family
has been, and continues to be, a ?long and winding road?. To fulfill our dream we
chose to adopt from China. At times we have found the process to be both difficult
and exhausting. We have had to submit to the scrutiny of our adoption agency,
our state, our federal government, and the Chinese government.

The investment of our time, money and emotions has been substantial. We have
followed all the rules of both the United States and the Peoples Republic of China.
We filled out the dozens of required forms, ordered the required documents,
prepared our dossier and immigration files and sent them to China. Finally, after
all this, we have allowed ourselves to be filled with the overwhelming hopes, fears,
dreams and desires of all waiting parents!

As part of this process we are required to obtain USCIS approval (form I-171H).
Our approval has been processed and according to current regulations is valid for
18 months. Until recently, this approval period served families adopting from China
quite well. However, China is now experiencing a significant increase in the length
of time it will take to match us with our child. Therefore, like most other families
now in the process of adopting from China, we will have to re-file their I-600A to get
a new I-171H.

The burden of paying and submitting a new I-600A for a file that is already
approved seems pointless and an unproductive use of USCIS resources. For us to
be asked to pay these fees twice certainly seems excessive and unwarranted. But
for us to be charged an increased fee on top of it seems absurd.

We hope for relief of the burden of submitting another I-600A for a new I-171H
since we have not even had the chance to use the one given to us initially. What?s
more, we ask that you please think of the many families like ours who are in the
process of adopting who could be effected by the additional costs of an already
expensive process and reconsider raising these fees.

Our hearts are open and eager to love a child adopted from China. Please do not
add additional time and cost simply because we want to be the parents of an
orphan. Please consider helping us by not increasing the fees.

Thank you for your time and thoughtfulness toward this matter.

Sincerely,

Kathryn and Brian Knox
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kathyrn Knox
